intro: Dodecaspermum, commonly known as the "twelve-seeded plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its succulent leaves and colorful, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. Dodecaspermum species typically produce small, capsule-like fruits containing multiple seeds, often around twelve, which is reflected in the genus name. These plants are popular among succulent enthusiasts due to their unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
